website_summaries.verdict: Heavy-duty grow bags that have a thicker fabric construction than some others.
pros: Even with a thicker fabric in the grow bags, they still give you aeration features that will keep your plants healthier
Tough fabric ensures the bag will stand up better on its own, making it easier to fill with dirt
Available in sizes ranging from 1 to 30 gallons for plenty of options for plant types
cons: These bags are wider than most, and sizes tend to run a little small

customer_reviews.title: THE INCREDIBLE SHRINKING BAGS - RUN AWAY! Measurements are now wrong.
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed with VIVOSUN's new gallon, which is no longer a gallon. They shrank their bags. The old (dirty) bag was purchased only 4 months ago. The diameters of both bags still measure 6 inches. However, as you can see, the new 1gallon bags have shrank from 8 inches tall to only 6.5 inches tall. Therefore, the product information is now wrong. Volume was reduced from 226 to 184 cubic inches, a 20% reduction from 1 gallon to 0.8 of a gallon. I want a refund! Also, I now must check the 3 gallon VIVOSUN bags I just purchased for shrinkage as well. Maybe they are shorting customers on all their bags.
customer_reviews.author: Chris G

customer_reviews.title: Nice for about 7 months, then fall apart.
customer_reviews.text: These pots were great until yesterday when two of them ripped. One of the handles came undone, and the other ripped right down the side. I bought them in March, so they only lasted about 7 months. Come on Vivosun, step up the quality in these pots!
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great pot, great price.
customer_reviews.text: In general the price was right and the quality felt solid vs the competition. I have previously purchased these type of pots from 2 other companies and these seem as good if not better. Why 3 stars? Well one of the pots had a hole at the bottom - a manufacturing defect I'm sure. See the photo. But I just noticed it a little over a month after purchasing and not sure what if anything could be done at this point. Update: Customer service contacted me soon after I posted my review and offered to make it right. I changed my review to 5 stars because they truly stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: HTS

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I wish i knew about these before. I've always bought traditional planting pots for growing. Traditional pots cost more and do not let your plants grow as well. The info says these 5 gallon sacks let the roots grow more efficient and allows the soil to breath and water to hydrate the plant better. I am not a green thumb by any means and gave these a shot, mainly due to price. They really work. My plants took quicker, grew taller, and looked much healthier by harvest time. All for a fraction of the cost. 5 stars of awesomeness!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Will never grow my veggies in anything else!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, why did we not try these sooner!! Went nuts & ended up buying a total of 15 bags to plant my veggies in. Happiest my veggies have ever been. Set some on slabs of flagstone, some on mulch & some on stands. All doing great plus I love being able to move them around as needed. Had them all close together when first planted, then as everything gets bigger, just slide them further apart.
customer_reviews.author: Sue B.

customer_reviews.title: My tomatoes love these pots
customer_reviews.text: My tomatoes love these pots. Being fabric they drain very well and allow your roots to breath which results in both faster growth and greater plant vigor. Although plastic pots have their application, whenever possible I use fabric pots, they are a superior choice.
customer_reviews.author: Organic Gardener

customer_reviews.title: Great, inexpensive way to grow veggies
customer_reviews.text: Bought these last winter. Everything I planted in them grew great, green beans, limas, winter squash, summer squash, and a blackberry bush. The soil I used settled considerably, so some were not very full and the edges flipped inward. Once the plants grew taller it was no problem. I have them resting directly on the ground and on rubber tiles, depending on their location. I moved some frequently as the angle of the sun changed - I don’t get much sun. They are easy to move dry and weigh a LOT wet at 25 gallons, but everything held up well. The handles are really helpful. We had endless rain this summer, they drained very well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Majane

customer_reviews.title: Better and sturdier than the leading brand for 1/3 the price.
customer_reviews.text: These grow bags are definitely the best value in the market. They are far thicker than the leading brand and about a third the price. These are so thick and sturdy that they stand up while you are filling them. This may seem like a small thing but when you are doing 20 of them at a time it makes a big difference. Also, the handles are far more sturdy and attached way better than the leading expensive brand. Even the 20 gallon bags I use for trees can be picked up and carried by the handles (2 people) with never a worry that they will tear off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Dupre

customer_reviews.title: They are Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Last year was my first year using these grow bags as a raised garden. They are Awesome!!! They are great for the roots and my plants did well in them. This past week I decided to change some things in my raised bag garden. I have about 20 grow bags and was able to move them all around the yard even with the soil still in them. I even have a huge one and was able to drag it around to where I wanted it. These hold up extremely well! The ones I used last year still look like new even after being in all different weather conditions. I will be buying more to add to my garden this year.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Naughton

customer_reviews.title: Quick Shipping, Well Made, Easy to Use!  Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The 25 Gallon Grow Bags are huge. I checked out the construction upon arrival. They are very well made! It took a little over 2 cu ft to fill each container. The containers hold several items. One lettuce, kale, spinach and herbs. The others have larger items in the middle with smaller ones surrounding them. I am EXTREMELY happy with this product and would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Hearty healthy plants no matter what kind flourish in these planters
customer_reviews.text: If you want to grow any kind of vegetable or plant this is the perfect pot to grow it in. These pots allow the roots to breathe to get oxygenated they are fantastic and my plants are flourishing!!
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works grate and is for sale at a good price. I still mess up and over water ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a flower pot what can I say. Works grate and is for sale at a good price. I still mess up and over water my tomatoes. These pots breath and allow air to get to the roots and also allows excess water to drain off. I will continue to order these.
customer_reviews.author: TIN EAR

customer_reviews.title: Using the fabric bags are fantastic. I bought them for tomato plants
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of the idea of fabric planters, especially being a farm girl, who was use to growing vegetation from the earth. Using the fabric bags are fantastic. I bought them for tomato plants, and they are thriving wonderfully. In addition. The bags makes it easier to rotate, and water your plants. I would recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: DEJ901

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Using these to grow marijuana instead of plastic pots. These work excellent plants are growing wonderfuly. A little hard to move around but with two people it is possible. Very sturdy material. Definitely recommend these and will be using again next year.UPDATE DO NOT DO BUSINESS WITH THIS COMPANY THEY ARE DISHONEST THEY SAY YOU HAVE A 3-YEAR WARRANTY BUT WILL NOT REPLACE THE PRODUCT WHEN IT RIPS .SAID INSTEAD THEY WOULD GIVE ME A $15 REFUND BUT THEY ONLY GAVE ME $11 WHEN I MESSAGE THEM I HAVE HAD NO FURTHER CONTACT.
customer_reviews.author: VCortez

customer_reviews.title: Big change in the quality from one year ago.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 5 pack of these 10 gallon grow bags one year ago and was very happy with the quality of the bags I received. The material was nice and durable with strong sturdy handles. I just received a shipment of 5 more 10 gallon bags and they are very poor quality. Flimsy thin fabric and weak handles. I reordered these bags because I liked the quality of the original ones I purchased. I would appreciate an explanation from the seller.
customer_reviews.author: william b. brady

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, thin, garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these same pots from another seller last time, yet this time the 5 gallon was more like half the size of a 5 gallon bucket. Don't know why but it seems they are thinner, handles are cheap, and overall not what I was expecting.
customer_reviews.author: SecretStashXpress

customer_reviews.title: Not as Described
customer_reviews.text: Order up a size!! Not as described. I bought 2 packs of 5 gallon bags. They are barely 2.5 gallons at best. Won’t be able to use these for tomatoes. The photo shows a two gallon bucket sitting next to and inside the ‘5 gallon’ grow bag. A shame too, the seem like very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: handle ripped off within 3 weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like these bags but in less than one month they ripped at the handle. This was only my second time moving the 25 gallon pot.
customer_reviews.author: HealthyFamily

customer_reviews.title: The handle ripped after 5 weeks.
customer_reviews.text: I transplanted a plant into one of these bags on June 16th & the handle ripped (1/2 way down the bag) on July 27th. I'm 14 days into a flowering cycle so it's not feasible for me to transplant again, I used duct tape to "repair" & am now stuck trying to maneuver this very heavy bag w/o the use of a handle on one side. Cheap, cheap, cheap...don't use unless you are keeping the plant stationary.
customer_reviews.author: michelle napier

customer_reviews.title: JUNK and SIZED WRONG
customer_reviews.text: I own 35 of these which were bought at different times. All are labeled as 5 gallons except they are all various diameters. Some look to be at least 50% larger than others. I will not buy this brand again because I need a specific size and Vivosun company doesn’t appear concerned with quality control. Instead of a 12” diameter, some are at least 16”. If space is important, if you don’t want to waste soil or other growing medium....use anything but this brand. I’ve just ordered 35 of the “247” brand 5 gallon fabric pots from amazon which appear to be consistent in size based on a previous order of 5.
customer_reviews.author: Terrrbear

customer_reviews.title: Bags falsely labeled !
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 5 gallon bags. When I got them, they were 3 gallon bags with a 5 gallon label on them! So it’s false advertising with size. The way I measured them was putting my 3 gallon water bottle right next to it, and it was an exact match, even fit inside the bag perfectly. Then put my 5 gallon water bottle next to it, and it was way off! Very disappointed that the manufacturer has no idea how to label correctly.
customer_reviews.author: astro88girl

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Everything fell apart.
customer_reviews.text: These lasted one full month before the sides ripped apart and soil fell all over. Total waste of money. Not to mention the fact that every plant I put in them DIED within days. Whatever chemical is on them leached into the soil and killed my ENTIRE garden.
customer_reviews.author: Kymmie

customer_reviews.title: Bags came on time and appear good quality, BUT for the life of me one ...
customer_reviews.text: Bags came on time and appear good quality, BUT for the life of me one cannot find out what they are made off. Even after some emails and company website searches the message got repeated that it was woven material. What is it made of? Angel's hair, unicorn fur, polyethylene, polyester, old tires, inquiring minds would like to now!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JustShoped

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: My potatoes are doing great in the fabric pot. They are very large, so I ended up using just one. I did notice that the soil compared to normal pots dries up faster.
customer_reviews.author: KBest

customer_reviews.title: Did not get the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I received five 1 gallon containers unless it expands which I doubt. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lu1975

customer_reviews.title: Fraud - Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: Paid for 5 bags and got 1. It also arrived from some strange address in China. Do not trust this purveyor of goods. Appears to be one of the occasional frauds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Falls apart.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these March 27.... it is now April 30th... I used potting mix. I'm Growing tomatoes in California. All my tomatoes are growing and all of the fabric on all of these are falling apart with potting mix is falling out everywhere. At the rate the fabric is falling apart. I doubt it will last long enough for my tomatoes to make it. I'm extremely dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: On the small side
customer_reviews.text: I think these bags are a bit on the small side but the jury is still out on that. The plan is to come back and update as the growing season progresses. So- it's June. A bit small and they drain well, making me wonder about moisture retention. ** update July 21, 2020** These bags are large enough to grow healthy plants and get an okay yield, but it's difficult to keep the plants sufficiently watered in dry, hot weather. Lots of watering to do with these, and I mean lots. I even used a soil mix that is supposed to help retain moisture. Next year, I may use these for herbs and go back to buckets for veggies.
customer_reviews.author: Rayne Forrest

customer_reviews.title: ... pots hold about 3 gallons of dirt not 5 like they
customer_reviews.text: these so called 5 gallon pots hold about 3 gallons of dirt not 5 like they should. vivosun contacted me and said the bags were standard size if I wanted bags that held 5 gallons of dirt I should buy bigger bags ,they also said they would send out a 5 pack of 10 gallon bags that hold 5 gallons , this they did and I have received the bags and have plants growing in them thank you vivosun you now have a faithful customer
customer_reviews.author: Louis D.

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 5 pots arrived Defective....
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, almost half of my items arrived defective. I bought the 5 pack of 5 gallon pots and for some reason the inner bottom seam of 2 of them were not sewn correctly, leaving holes for the soil to come through. I think that the product would be a great investment had these QC issues not had been there. I would have definitely given them 5 stars, but the fact that 2 out of the 5 were defective.... I chose the smaller rating. I was so excited to receive these, and once I placed the soil into the pots and got them going, I noticed considerable leakage from the openings at the bottom seams. :(
customer_reviews.author: BIOMEDMAN

customer_reviews.title: Good bags, but size down if using on patio
customer_reviews.text: These have worked very well for my patio tomato plants this year. They're growing like gangbusters! The only downside is that the bags are very wide at the base and I didn't realize when I got them that they should be elevated off the deck. The 15 gallon ones are too wide to fit on standard trays or pot elevators. I wish I had gotten one size smaller to accommodate this need. I use a 16" pot elevator and it really needs a 20" one. The 10 gallon bag would have been better for my cherry tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot of water comes out the sides
customer_reviews.text: So the first thing I noticed with these and why they get the 3 stars.. You really have to slow down your watering otherwise it just comes out the sides through the fabric. I am growing 4 plants at the moment in these indoors. My concern is when it comes time to flush them a couple weeks before harvest, I am going to have to use a ton more water because its not draining through to the bottom of the container. After this grow I think I will go back to my plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: mnfishbro

customer_reviews.title: Bugs love them
customer_reviews.text: Product is a great harborer for pests on the side of the fiber pot, thrips and fungus gnats will lay eggs on the side of the fiber material, will never use fiber pots over plastic pots.
customer_reviews.author: Immo

customer_reviews.title: Not close close to 3 gallons...
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to 3 gal.. How the heck do you market/sell an item that's completely inaccurate? I even saw another review after I ordered these that said they shrunk from previous orders! I am very disappointed with these and will be returning them...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not 5 gallons
customer_reviews.text: With all the 5 star reviews I took a chance. They are good to for plants that easily over watered. The would be wonderful for any gardening projects with young kids. As many other reviews have stated, there's no way these are 5 gallons. They aren't horrible considering you get 5 for $20 if you're looking for a long term planter solution this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: blissfullinsanity

customer_reviews.title: Planted blueberries in 8 of the 20 gallon pots I purchased.
customer_reviews.text: My blueberries are doing the best they ever had. I almost gave up trying to grow blueberries after trying for 5 years. One month after transplanting to these pots they are not only living, but the blueberries are bigger than ever. Bad news is I tried to move one of the pots so I can mow and the pot ripped where the handled is located. The pot is filled only a little past half way. Now I am afraid to try to move the others to the location I want them to be.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not a true 7 gallon bag
customer_reviews.text: Looks like a 5 gallon not a 7!! Measurements do not meet up with your website measurements for 7 gallon ..the tag says 7 gallon 27 l. Next to my phat sack 7 gallon theres no comparison.. Not what i expected..too small not true 7 gal.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality grow bags at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using fabric grow bags for several years now. They work great as they prune the root system while bringing it oxygen. The major brand that's sold at my local grow shop works great but is kinda pricey. I bought some cheaper ones but the problem was they were thin, flimsy and water would just run right through them. It would be pouring out the sides of the bags as soon as I started watering. These vivosun bags are every bit as good, if not better them the expensive ones, at a much better price. If you're thinking about trying fabric grow bags, try these.
customer_reviews.author: robojon828

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: These are a felt material, so water does get out. I transplanted a tomato plant from a plastic pot to this and am blown away by how much the plant came back to life. It's currently on my deck and will be brought inside when it gets cooler. I'm also thinking to move my liberty pepper plant into one of these. They're super easy to move around too. Not too heavy when filled with dirt and cage (tomato). Interested to see how long these bags hold.
customer_reviews.author: CrazyHorrorGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too poreous.
customer_reviews.text: Does not help in containment of moisture like the other bags I am using. I must water twice daily while the other just require watering half as often. Do not recommend these but the bag concept is great
customer_reviews.author: K. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Luv the bags, but plants dry out too quickly...
customer_reviews.text: I have several different sizes of these bags, up to this 20 gallon size. This size seems to be a problem for the plants (tomatoes and cucumbers). I water in the early morning, and the plants are drooping by mid afternoon and need another drink. The soil just dries out too quickly. I used the smaller bags for pepper plants, there are no problems with those.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: VivoSun 5Gal grow bags heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these 5 gallon grow bags for about 1 1/2 months now and so far they've held up great without breaking or tearing and I move these a couple times every day. The downfall however, is that they dry out way too fast, especially in comparison to my 5 gallon plastic containers. So you better throw some mulch on top or else you'll be watering everyday, especially in the heat of summer!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Oliva

customer_reviews.title: Not consistent quality!
customer_reviews.text: Companies product is not constant!! I have bougt several orderes of grow bags fro. 3 different companies. I just recieved 30 gallon bags that were 1 inch shorted in depth and thinner.
customer_reviews.author: Donna G.

customer_reviews.title: perfect solution to grow plants
customer_reviews.text: I found these bags to be very useful to grow roses or any other plants due to the soil quality where I live; it is very hard and full of rocks. The only drawback, the plants have to be watered quite often if there is no rain because the sun is very hot in my area. Also, during grass mowing bags may be damaged during edging is someone is not careful. Overall, it is the great solution to grow plants when not land/soil available.
customer_reviews.author: Vita

customer_reviews.title: NOT 3 gallon
customer_reviews.text: Would have been great for what I was wanting if it even came close to being 3 gallons
customer_reviews.author: dobiegirls

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Experimenting with a self water grow bag. Cut a 3" hole in the PVC pipe, caped both ends with a float value in one end. Hooked it up to a rain harvest barrel to maintain the water level. Sliced the bottom of the grow bags for a 3: neti pot to slide through and packed with peat moss. Definitely some improvements to be done in the next design but I am happy with these grow bags.
customer_reviews.author: Tram

customer_reviews.title: 1 gallon grow bag
customer_reviews.text: Well I bought the 1 gallon size, the paper that came with the product said 1 gallon but the actual size is the 2 gallon one. This worked out great as I actually needed the bigger size. Overall this works out great. Keeps the dirt in and as long as you don't over water, the water stays in. I've only had a plant, currently zucchini, in it for about two weeks. It's growing great. I didn't put the dirt in it like the directions mention to keep things looking perfect but it still works out perfectly. These are going to be temporary spots for a few plants. I am happy with these :)
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Who Knew!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed how easy the Plant Grow bags are to use. I bought the 7, 10, 15 and 20 Gallon 5 packs. I'll need more:~) Once you try them you will want to add them to your inventory of potting solutions. Pro Tip: Before you use your bag, dunk them in water and squeeze off the excess then fill with your soil mixture. This give the soil a good moisture boost! Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: PigHippoMomster

customer_reviews.title: Rip-off.  Not a 5-gallon container.
customer_reviews.text: Inaccurate description. These are not even close to 5 gallons. See photo for reference. If I felt like doing geometry I suppose I could calculate the actual volume, but looks like about 3 gallons, maybe 3.5 max.
customer_reviews.author: Trixie

customer_reviews.title: Great as pot or container liners where traditional pots won't fit
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my purpose. I am not growing vegetables and the breathing roots are not of interest. I have been an avid horticulturist for 50+ years. Growing amazing plants in plastic or terracotta pots is no challenge to me at all. These are bring used as liners in 2 large cast iron urns in infront of my home. They are an unusual size and shape so regular growers pots don't fit properly. They are perfect for this application as the fabric conforms to the shape of the container it is in.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Just bought a third pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought some 7 gallons bags last year to grow eggplant and peppers on my porch after running out of room in my garden. They worked very well and I ended up using them over the winter for new blueberry bushes. Bought 10 gallon bags for young fig and persimmon trees and just bought more of the 7 gallon for this years garden. No issues. Easy to move, especially if you use a light potting or raised bed mix, and after a year, no tears or holes, even on the larger bags with heavier soil for the fruit trees. If you are looking to start a small garden or expand an existing one without building new beds, these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Not 7 gallons.
customer_reviews.text: Listed as a 7 gallon pot, it is only a bit over 4 gallons. I expected this to be tall as well in which it's a very short wide bag. Would not recommend unless you really wanted a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great for tomatoes and other large vegetable plants
customer_reviews.text: I planted several of these in my small garden and on my patio. So far they are holding up extremely well. I used container potting soil with moisture control as I was worried they would dry out because they are porous. These pots are doing as well as my raised beds and plants directly in the ground. These pots are somewhat thicker than the other 2 brands I have but all seem to perform about the same. the 25 gallon pot is substantial enough to support a 5 foot tall rebar ladder/cage support. Another has 4 peppers and the third has a vining cucumber with a trellis support. Very happy with the sturdiness and versatility of this product.
customer_reviews.author: FS_Wenatchee

customer_reviews.title: Thick and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great for a 30 gallon clot pot! Filled this up with dirt and watered it with 5 gallons. A day later lifted it with the stitched on handles to put a tray underneath for runoff and they held up. Great for anyone looking to have a larger pot and not worry about watering so often. Great drainage too while holding water on the sides. Obviously because it's cloth it drains good but I've used other brands that seem to retain less water and allow excessive water to come out of the sides before soaking into the first. Attributing this to the thickness of the cloth. Over all great purchase and I will definitely be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Bags
customer_reviews.text: The bags arrived on time in excellent condition. It was challenging to gage the right waterin schedule. The fabric holds moisture but it also radiant heat which requires watering more often during really hot day. I found plants that like deep watering and grouping in 4 to 5 works best for this size bag. To prevent gophers from eating through bags, I placed them on "free" wood pallets. Only negative comment is the placement of the handles makes lifting and carrying bags cumbersome.
customer_reviews.author: Juanita I

customer_reviews.title: Move total empty if you want them to last.
customer_reviews.text: I added soil and tried to move, handles ripped off the pots for 3 out of 5. I had another pack that I filled in place so no additional movement. I emailed company via there website about the 3 year warranty (existing during the purchase early last year) and now they say only 1-yr warranty in 2020 probably because they don't last 3-years. I guess if you fill on place their good. If you plan to move think twice or maybe use smaller bags. I'm trying a different company with better reinforced handles will see how that works.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Tomatoes Flourishing!
customer_reviews.text: Beginner gardener needs beginner tools. That’s me. I considered a raised-bed garden and ended up buying these. Right now I have one filled with three tomato plants and they are doing well. Considering that these plants were scruffy leftover plants, now they’ve filled out and have tomatoes waiting to ripen. I particularly like that I can’t overwater. Extra water drains away. My next challenge will be to plant chard when the weather cools down.
customer_reviews.author: Dinkydoright

customer_reviews.title: Fail
customer_reviews.text: I'm a fairly seasoned gardener. I figured I would put some extra melons and squash in these and move them as the other plants in my garden grow. Nothing grows in these while my plants planted in the ground thrive. I water them regularly and still death. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: FarmMom

customer_reviews.title: Nothing better for my plants
customer_reviews.text: I have used these grow bags for over 10 years, these replaced old worn bags. These bags beat out the hard black pots down to the ground. Promote a healthy root ball and no swirling roots, they don't heat up in the sun like conventional pots and if I place the bottom of the bag 4" in the dirt my plant grown even better. Buy and use these bags you will see how good they are and how your plants will thrive.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Lazcano

customer_reviews.title: My favorite grow bags!
customer_reviews.text: I came across Vivosun this year and so far I've been blown away with how happy my plants have been outside. The price point is fantastic and no quality issues. Having handles makes it so much less awkward moving plants in the garden as needed. The 20 gallons pots are much larger than the 7-gallon pots I have been using but getting ready for fall veggies has caused me to need larger pots for greens, broccoli, and more! If you are looking for something movable that your plants will love, these are the pots for you
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write such negative reviews for anything, as I like to find something good to say, however, this item was way off of the mark. A package of 5 Gallon grow bags were ordered, and a package of "5 Gallon bags" arrived. But upon opening the package and inspecting the grow bags it was easy to see that these things were nowhere near being 5 gallons. I even took a five gallon plastic bucket and slid it into one of the grow bags, and the top of the bucket stuck up above the top of the bag by several inches while the sides fit snug inside of the bag. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: David Aleshire

customer_reviews.title: Size are definitely inaccurate, smaller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and also another set of 6 from another amazon buyer with a lot cheaper price to compare with. Vivosun's material are much thicker and seems more durable than the cheaper one, however the size is very different. I bought both 7 Gallon, vivosun is much smaller and the height is lower too. In terms of quality I would say fine, but the size is just smaller than it says.
customer_reviews.author: Jacky

customer_reviews.title: Theses are pretty large. Should probably have gotten 15 gallon ones ...
customer_reviews.text: Theses are pretty large. Should probably have gotten 15 gallon ones but they work well. Moving it alone full of dirt is a chore so two is a better. Just planted some tomatoes and weed in them so I'll update you later on how they work.
customer_reviews.author: BDean707

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and reusable
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something very light and movable and I also did not want to store more large pots over the winter. I used these to plant some tomato plants, when I grew too many from seed to fit in the garden. I got 10 gallon size, which works, but I might try 20 gallon for larger tomato plants next time. They are very light, but I still put them on a rolling bases. Even without that they would be easily moved into the sun during the day and into the garage overnight when the temperature dropped. The plants are now much bigger than their siblings that went in the raised beds.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Bags look good!!!
customer_reviews.text: So far ok! I ordered after reading several reviews indicating concerns re quality control......these are the dimensions specified, and all stitching appears good. Price offers an excellent cost effective opportunity to try this growing concept. Also spoke to another person who indicated satisfaction with their bags after two years. I also ordered a Smart Pot container so that I could compare. Will post update after growing season, planting blueberries and blackberries initially.....may order more and try something else :)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Jan

customer_reviews.title: Durable product for our porch-garden
customer_reviews.text: We don't have a good place for a garden in our small yard so we decided to do one on the porch using these fabric planters. We debated between smaller sizes but ultimately I'm glad we went with the 20 gallons because we're able to fold the bag's edges down so we don't have to use as much soil but we get the large diameter we were looking for. They drain nicely, have been easy to move around as needed, and I'm interested to see how they will empty and clean up at the end of the season so we can store them again for next year. Overall very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: Functional but slightly smaller
customer_reviews.text: These grow pots are pretty awesome! I had recently switched over from plastic pots to these and I am glad I did. Not only is the price great for a 5 pack but they work very well. They are sturdy enough to carry soil but light enough to move around fairly easy. I would definitely recommend this product. They do seem a bit smaller than a 5gal bucket but overall I think they work great. I would probably recommend to get a 7 gal if you are worried about space the 10gal are wide ( I also bought) so if you are looking for taller pots they fall short there. But the price and functionality are here for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Zepeda

customer_reviews.title: First time user of grow pots. Bought 15 and ...
customer_reviews.text: First time user of grow pots.Bought 15 and 20 gallon. The 4 inch difference in height is noticeable for the 20 gallon but they may be overkill since only single indeterminate tomatoes were put in each based on recommendations of current owners. The bags can be moved after filling but I slid them rather than picking them up. No handles tore. I have no brand comparison since this is a first time use. The bags seem strong enough for their intended purpose and it is too soon to evaluate durability.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: New user!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews I wanted to try these. My clay mix of dirt in my yard, wasn’t my friend last year with the crazy weather changes, so I wanted to try with a container. So far so good with these containers. The material is breathable and my plants so far seem to be doing well. I’m already seeing a green pepper budding! I will say the sides can get a bit flimsy but I filled It with a lot of dirt and used metal plant support Stands to help keep it upright. I’m happy with this purchase and depending on how my veggies and herbs grow, I will Purchase more.
customer_reviews.author: Anjaneen

customer_reviews.title: The moving garden.....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for ease of moving. My large trees shade too much to have a garden in one spot....I love fresh vegetables...so I’m trying this for the first time...using a pallet to keep off of the ground. The handles allowed me to move them with relative ease! I’ve already had to move them once. I’ll keep you posted on the progress! The green tomatoes may not get to ripen as I love fried green tomatoes. I’m growing peppers, tomatoes, sweet basil and tomatoes.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: Great! Have Used for Years
customer_reviews.text: Plants, even vegetable, grow exceedingly well in these fabric pots. From experience, they will help your plant survive being transplanted after becoming root bound. I have been using them for few years. They can be washed and re-used. Even if outside, you may want to also use plastic trays underneath. I use them along a walkway, where tree roots make it impossible to dig. I change the flowers in the Fall and Sprint. These are ornamental cabbage I set out this past Fall. I have grown tomatoes and peppers in them with great success.
customer_reviews.author: Goldenmom

customer_reviews.title: Quality and Size Choice
customer_reviews.text: I have successfully started 3 flowering crab apple roots from a beautiful tree in our front yard. I used the 7gallon bags as the trees are now 2-3 ft, but unsafe in extreme heat to plant until rains in Fall. I will be able to easily move from a current, protected spot to back and plant in this 'container' after opening the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Rieder

customer_reviews.title: So far, awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have only had them a few weeks, but they're fantastic. They drain properly and my plants are growing well in them. I recently decided to move them to a better spot in my yard, and was concerned that the handles would tear out when fully loaded with soil. Nope! Admittedly, it was like a four-minute trip, but I didn't have to hug the things to get them over there. I can't speak to their durability or how long they last, but so far, I would buy them every year. This kill-everything-woman has become a gardener and a plant farmer!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in the size misrepresentation in the description
customer_reviews.text: I just received my 7 gallon bags (two sets of 5) a few minutes ago and mine were also 10" inches tall (expected 12" tall). I am debating as to whether I will keep them or not. Disappointed in the size misrepresentation in the description. The packaging indicates no size information. If I decide to keep them I will update this review based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: ResilientOne

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 5 pack of 25 gallon pots. Received this today and 1 pot is damaged, has a hole at the bottom seam. The material and seams appear to be of low quality. The seam looks like it would easily unravel, so cant imagine that this could hold 25 gallons of soil plus plant and be maneuverable. Disappointed. Will probably switch to smart pots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get what was shown in picture
customer_reviews.text: The item I received is not what is pictured. The handles on these fabric pots do not come up further than the top of the pot like shown. It seems like a small thing but if you have to pick these up multiple times with hundreds of plants it makes a large difference. This is false advertising. The fabric pots I received are much cheaper than what is pictured here. Amazon please fix this.
customer_reviews.author: heath brockway

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Comparing this product with plastic containers on line, I was impressed with the description and reviews, so went with the Vivosun pots. Yesterday I transplanted 4 trident maples from the ground into Vivosun pots. I was pleased with how sturdy these are and how relatively easy it was to transplant a tree with root ball into one. When I had the transplants done, I was even more pleased with how easy it was to carry the heavy pots by the attached handles. I like this product and will purchase again. I recommend Vivosun pots.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but lightweight
customer_reviews.text: These were an experiment. Sturdy but lightweight, fast delivery. As far as actually being an effective container for tomatoes and peppers, no: scrawny, poor production, very thirsty. Maybe these work farther north, but definitely not in East Tennessee summers.
customer_reviews.author: TNamazoncustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and awesome duribility
customer_reviews.text: These 5 gallon bush and small, meduim, tree buckets are the best. I received 2 of these as a gift from a friend of mine and then I in turn ordered 2 packs of 5 and I use them for when I first get a tree or bush to establish them in my soil mixture and then 2 months and then I plant the tree or bush where I want it and then wash the fabric bucket and reuse it. This can be used for large plants and flowers too. I have used them for starting bulbs in Feb and March in the house. I love these and recommend them if you are a serious gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda1

customer_reviews.title: Not Quite
customer_reviews.text: Received very quickly, well packed and seem good quality. Filled with soil and they feel VERY sturdy. But I had to wonder if they were quite 7 gallons. The volume equals pi times the radius squared times the height. Using that, they are about 5.5 gallons. I'm using them for a temporary garden while I build a retaining wall for my new garden space, so I'm sure they'll be fine. Just keep that in mind. If I bought the 5 gallon version, this would be 5-plus stars...but they aren't quite what they said they'd be.
customer_reviews.author: C. Moore-Buutz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome value and great drainage
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe I paid such a low cost for this much value in return. I'm a novice to the world of gardening but im mighty glad I found this product. Currently have a mango, Barbados cherry, papaya, sapodilla, and indian Jujube, going in their respective pots. Just want to be considerate of how well this pot drains and I would opt in for slow release of anything instead of liquid fertilizer so you won't lose your fertilizer to this items magnificent draining ability. Honestly I can't see root rot plaguing me now!
customer_reviews.author: ArchDekan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality Bags
customer_reviews.text: You can spend a lot more, but you won't get a better bag. I just smile when I pass by these air pots at my local nursery and see that they want as much for two of these types of pots as I paid for five, and these are a better quality. If you're looking for good pots that allow air circulation to the root system, and don't want to pay too much, here you go.
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Mike

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good! - Really like!
customer_reviews.text: I can't claim moving around is easy because once full of topsoil, it's quite heavy. That's expected! I did need to move one because it was too close for growing space requirements of another plant. Two people can move one with some struggle because it really is heavy (25 lbs. of soil is heavy)... moving a little bit, sort of a twisting motion, left, right and repeat until in new position. It's best to have in the spot you're sure of from the start. It's made well. I really do like and plan to purchase 10 lb. bags next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Thick, strong and sturdy. I live in central Texas where it gets hot hot hot and no rain for 2 months or better. These hold moisture but not too much. My new baby Blueberries seem to be adjusting well. I’m ordering more. Growing in bags and 18 gallon totes is the way to go
customer_reviews.author: scwheeler

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Move & Plants Doing Great
customer_reviews.text: We decided to put together an entire container garden this year. We live in the country and weeds are a constant nuisance, even more so than in the city. I did use soil specific for containers and mulched the surface of the planter. We do have to water more often but we are very pleased so far with the results. I like the fact that I can move plants around with minimal bending. At almost 60 years old, this is a big help! We will have to move plants into a shed come winter but still not a big issue for us. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: CM Ohio

customer_reviews.title: BUY SOMEWHERE ELSE
customer_reviews.text: FALSE ADVERTISING! The product is great but I was expecting 5 of them, seeing as the title is "5 pack of 20 gallon..." and you only get one. I've tried contacting the supplier and all they do is ask if you want to buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Anna DiCocco

customer_reviews.title: Not quite 3 gallon but more like 10 Liters
customer_reviews.text: I only received 4 of the 5 pots. We had a violent wind storm that almost killed my Blue Java Banana tree, I bought the 3 gal. size for an upgrade from 1 gal pot. I used a 3 gallon Vigoro plastic pot from Home Depot to compare and this Vivoson could only hold 3/4 of that soil. So I put a tiny bit over 1 gallon of new soil in this bag with my 1 gallon Banana tree and it got that full (see pic). Otherwise a great pot, I'll buy more but my advice is, buy 1 size up. UPDATE; Vivosun and Amazon made it right, got my 5th pot and I'm HAPPY
customer_reviews.author: Paul L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great For What I Needed!
customer_reviews.text: I purchase these because here in Chicago when it's winter time I got tired of having my outdoor plant/flower pots cracking when the moisture in the soil freezes and expands. Now with these as the soil freezes and expands, so do these fabric pots. No more broken Styrofoam, Plastic or Ceramic pots to replace! I have even painted all of my fabric pots (with for plastic spray paint) to change the black color and to match any decor!
customer_reviews.author: Eddy O.

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and portable
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality. Stands up perfectly and the perfect solution to aerate the roots. Perfect for my indoor veggie project this winter. Project is for an experiment in one of my upcoming books and I'm really "rooting" for these bag since I'm a first time bag user and always looking for new products to recommend to my readers. Will upgrade to a 5 if they hold out like I hope.
customer_reviews.author: LifePathin4D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic results
customer_reviews.text: I now have these in several sizes. 30 gal for my corn, 20 gal for my tomatoes, 25 gal for my blueberries. I have just recently purchased the 15 gal for eggplant and maybe my peppers. These are fantastic. I saw another review that showed them elevated on concrete blocks. That worked wonderfully. The results this year so far have been quite impressive . I fully intend to purchase these items again. Now all I need is to decide on a proper size for my squash. If you love to garden, then these are for you.
customer_reviews.author: Dee S.

customer_reviews.title: not good
customer_reviews.text: I would not purchase these again, they are not what I expected the water just goes thru the pot and the soil does not get wet, and the plant's do not grow, don't waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Nyoka

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love!
customer_reviews.text: I love these! I live in a cold climate and have left these outside each year during winter. Spring, summer, fall. They've been through 5 years of below freezing temps and the hot summer sun. I just ordered more to increase my container gardening capacity. I originally bought these because I didnt want to garden in plastic when growing my food and these have been the perfect solution. I also love the sturdy handles on each side to pick them up and move easily.
customer_reviews.author: S. D

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, reusable, plants love them!!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these for indoor growing. I was surprised at the quality of the pots. It feels almost like a thick, scratchy fleece, with small handles of the same material. The are big, and allowed plants to grow larger, compared to solid pots, plants did exceptionally better. Also, we were able to pick up 5 gallons of dirt and plant inside and the handles held up. No sign or sound of the stitching coming loose. Id definitely say the quality is unmatched . Once plants were done, we dumped the soil and are able to reuse them. We got more than our money’s worth between being able to use over and over, and how our plants thrives in them!
customer_reviews.author: REStew

customer_reviews.title: Nothing grows in them!
customer_reviews.text: My vegetables hate these fabric pots. My beets died right away. Everything else is just failure to thrive. My carrots, chard, and watermelon are still alive but none of them have grown. They are literally the same size in early August as they were when I planted them on Memorial Day. It’s very disappointing. I thought these were going to be perfect for container/patio gardening, but they were a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared to constantly water your plants.
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed. The sides should not be ventilated. They dry out so fast. I have to put a gallon of water everyday on my tomato plant.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tomatoes and you will live these.
customer_reviews.text: Tomatoes love these bags. Very sturdy. Can be moved but heavy with 20 gallons of soil. Planted starter plants beginning of June. Plants are 8 feet tall with a boatload of tomatoes growing. Used tomatoes cages in the bags with little wooden feet I made on the wire ends so not to damage the bag bottoms. Had to make a wooden structure to hold up the plants due to their size. Have some 5 and 10 gallon grow bags from last season. All holding up well. However the tallest plants are in the biggest bags. Smaller sized bags growing well, but not as tall.
customer_reviews.author: Y. M. Collins

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and $$$ down the drain! Skip these!
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing like the first set I ordered one month ago. These are made of much thinner material and the seams are loose so they cannot be trusted to hold potting soil. Not even close to the same quality or product. Don't waste your $$$.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Okay for my maters, not so much my dahlias
customer_reviews.text: Because some of my plants are doing fine with these, I gave it a couple more stars. Otherwise I'm not happy that one of my dinnerplate dahlias has burnt edges on the plant, compared to my happier plants in my hydrofarm dirt pots. I notice the water runs out of the sides a lot more easily than my hydrofarm dirt pots. It's not as substantial a pot. I planted all of my dahlias on the same day--you can see the difference in growth/health.
customer_reviews.author: playful mom of two

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy HomeProDirect's 4-pack of Castor Wheels, they'll only ship 2
customer_reviews.text: These are great! Somehow my negative Amazon review of HomeProDirect's "4-pack" of Castor Wheels (4" Swivel Caster Wheels with Safety Dual Locking and Polyurethane Foam No Noise Wheels, Heavy Duty - 300 Lbs Per Caster (Pack of 4)) which only shipped with 2, got transferred over as a 1-star review of this product. And I can't figure out where/how to delete that review, darnit. So... these pots are great! But be careful if you try to move heavy material like sand in one; the bags can rip if you pull from the handle when they're carrying a lot of weight. Happened to me with one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: smaller than i expected
customer_reviews.text: i am only reviewing this on first impression as it is January and wont be planting in them until this summer. i ordered the 1 gallon size and they are way smaller than i expected right out of the package. they are made a fabric so with weight i expect them to stretch some but they are small. like you took a gallon milk jug and put to handles off the sides. will review more later. the shipping is another issue. USPS delivered them 2 days late. i wish we would choose who we shipped thought. not happy with USPS service.
customer_reviews.author: Charney

product_meta.title: VIVOSUN 5-Pack 5 Gallon Grow Bags Heavy Duty 300G Thickened Nonwoven Plant Fabric Pots with Handles
feature_bullets: STURDY FABRIC MATERIAL: Made of 300g thickened nonwoven fabric, these pots are moderately permeable, environmentally friendly, and BPA-free
GREAT DRAINAGE: Nonwoven fabric means the pots do not retain excess water, allowing your roots to breathe, translating to a healthier, more vigorous growth

DURABLE, REINFORCED HANDLES: While the competition uses flimsy handles that are a continuation of the same fabric the pot is made from, we use serging stitches to sew handles onto the pot so they can support a full bag of soil
PORTABLE BAGS: Both heavy-duty handles and rugged material means you can move bags full of soil and plants with ease
USE IT FOR YEARS: Bags prevent circling root structure. Combined with pruning and trimming roots, these bags can be reused for years. Comes with a 1-year warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars9,615 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
